test_port_write.c

00001 
00020 #include <sys/io.h>
00021 #include <unistd.h>
00022 #include <stdio.h>
00023 #include <stdlib.h>
00024 #include <string.h>
00025 
00026 typedef unsigned char byte;
00027 typedef unsigned short boolean;
00028 
00029 #define true 1
00030 #define false 0
00031 
00032 #define PORT 0x80       /* Port to use */
00033 
00034 /* Time between letters in seconds */
00035 #define LETTER_WAIT .5
00036 
00037 /* Time between words in seconds */
00038 #define WORD_WAIT 1.5
00039 
00040 /* Converts the waits to the appropriate value for the
00041  *  function being used. Sleep supposedly takes decimal
00042  *  values, but it does not seem to work correctly with
00043  *  ones starting with 0
00044  * Currently converts micro seconds (10^-6) to seconds
00045  */
00046 #define WAIT_MULTIPLIER 1000000
00047 
00048 /* Use the usleep (microsecond precision) where the
00049  * sleep (second presision) function is called
00050  */
00051 #define sleep usleep
00052 
00053 int main(int argc, char** argv)
00054 {
00055   int io_status = ioperm(PORT,  /* port number 0x000 - 0x3ff */
00056                          1,     /* number of ports to access */
00057                          true); /* boolean true to gain,
00058                                    false to release */
00059 
00060   /* Having gained access to the port the root privileges
00061      may be dropped if this program is being run suid */
00062   int drop_status = setuid(getuid());
00063 
00064   /* Test the name to know how to run */
00065   int print = strcmp(argv[0], "print_write") == 0 ? true : false;
00066 
00067   /* Time to wait between letters */
00068   int letter_wait = LETTER_WAIT * WAIT_MULTIPLIER;
00069 
00070   /* Time to wait between words */
00071   int word_wait = WORD_WAIT * WAIT_MULTIPLIER;
00072 
00073   /* Used to track the position in the string */
00074   int charind;
00075 
00076   /* Part of using get_opt; tracks the return status */
00077   int opt_status = 0;
00078   do
00079     {
00080       opt_status = getopt(argc, argv, "l:w:");
00081       switch(opt_status)
00082         {
00083         case 'l':
00084           letter_wait =
00085             strtod(optarg, (char**)NULL) * WAIT_MULTIPLIER;
00086           break;
00087         case 'w':
00088           word_wait =
00089             strtod(optarg, (char**)NULL) * WAIT_MULTIPLIER;
00090           break;
00091         }
00092     }
00093   while(opt_status >= 0);
00094 
00095   if(io_status == 0)
00096     {
00097       for(charind = 0; optind < argc; charind = 0)
00098         {
00099           while(argv[optind][charind] != (char)NULL)
00100             {
00101               byte value =
00102                 (byte)argv[optind][charind++];
00103               if(print)
00104                 {
00105                   putchar(value);
00106                   fflush(stdout);
00107                 }
00108               else
00109                 {
00110                   outb(value, PORT);
00111                 }
00112               sleep(letter_wait);
00113             }
00114           if(++optind < argc)
00115             {
00116               if(print)
00117                 {
00118                   putchar(' ');
00119                 }
00120               if(letter_wait < word_wait)
00121                 {
00122                   sleep(word_wait - letter_wait);
00123                 }
00124             }
00125         }
00126     }
00127   if(print)
00128     {
00129       putchar('\n');
00130     }
00131   return io_status;
00132 }
